Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

His mind instantly came back to, after being unconscious for God knows how =
many days...weeks...............solar cycles, even.  The first thing he saw=
 was pitch black, until he realized he had yet to hvae his optics open.  In=
 the beginning, he wasn't quite sure if he wanted to open them, for fear th=
at he might go back to that infra-red vision.....for fear that he might sti=
ll hear that same droning phrase.....for fear he might see that same object=
 being waved in front of his face.  However, he decided to take the chance =
because one thing was different, and that was the fact that there was no ch=
ill on his back.  In fact, he wasn't even on his back, but rather, laying w=
ith his back up.  When he took a look to see where he was, he couldn't make=
 out anything because his face was buried into a soft sediment of sorts.  H=
e opened his mouth, just a little tad, in hopes of letting out even a small=
 gasp, to reassure himself that he was alive.  Bad timing...a swift wind dr=
ifted low across the ground, and he found himself getting on his knees and =
spitting out sand that just went into his mouth.  Once that little episode =
was sorted out, he looked around.  The land wasn't too barren, but it was a=
 bit scorched by the sun that loomed above him.  And it wasn't until after =
he took in his surroundings that he was hit by the fact that he was no long=
er inside a building, and there was nobody in his immediate vicinity, not t=
o mention that his vision and hearing were restored.  He tried to stand up,=
 but he failed and fell back to his knees.  He made a second attempt, and t=
his time got on both feet.  However, he was quite shaky, and it was almost =
as if he hadn't stood on two legs in eons.  Although slow and a bit wobbly,=
 he made his way across the land, and paused.  In the distance, he saw a tu=
ndra, and in it two creatures of which he'd never seen before were leaping =
with grace and speed.  This fascinated him, and then his spirit became brig=
hter as it occurred to him that there was indeed some life on this rock, an=
d that the chances of other creatures like him being here were a bit higher=
.

"Is there anybody out there!?" he managed to yell out in a dry voice thr=
ough a mouth that hadn't spoken in ages.

His voice trailed through the air=
 as he fell forward onto his knees, and had his head in his hands...
